name: Electronic
description: Uses non-traditional electronic instrumentation and sound manipulation technology as the primary backbone of a composition.

sub_genres.name: Acholitronix
sub_genres.description: Fusion of traditional Acholi rhythms and melodies with Electronic production, originating in the city of Gulu.

sub_genres.name: Algorave
sub_genres.description: Generative dancefloor-oriented music produced live via algorithms.

sub_genres.name: Binaural Beats
sub_genres.description: Auditory illusions created when two different frequencies are played simultaneously in separate ears.

sub_genres.name: Bit Music
sub_genres.description: Created by sound chips, cards, and sequencers found in video game consoles, personal computers, and arcade machines, as well as synthesizers emulating these sounds.

sub_genres.name: Bitpop
sub_genres.description: Fuses Bit Music with additional synths, beats, guitars and modern production values, emphasizing highly catchy melodies and relatively fast tempos.

sub_genres.name: Celtic Electronica
sub_genres.description: Fusion of Celtic Folk Music with various types of Electronic Dance Music.

sub_genres.name: Chillout
sub_genres.description: Broad category of many relaxed styles of Electronic music which predominantly draw influence from Electronic Dance Music subgenres and Ambient.

sub_genres.name: Digital Fusion
sub_genres.description: Incorporates the hardware-limited sounds of Chiptune and other Bit Music into compositions drawing on Jazz, Cinematic Classical, progressive music, and other Electronic styles, sometimes augmented with live instrumentation.

sub_genres.name: Drift Phonk
sub_genres.description: Busy, noisy production inspired by lo-fi Memphis Rap; frequently features 808 cowbell melodies and chopped, compressed samples.

sub_genres.name: Dungeon Synth
sub_genres.description: Focuses on evoking epic and atmospheric soundscapes primarily associated with fantasy and medieval settings through the usage of synthesizers, keyboards, lo-fi production, and drum machines.

sub_genres.name: Electro Hop
sub_genres.description: Emerged in the mid 2000s featuring upbeat rap verses and catchy hooks over four-on-the-floor Electropop and  Electro House-inspired production.

sub_genres.name: Electro-Industrial
sub_genres.description: Formed in the late 1980s and early 1990s; grew out of a combination of EBM and Industrial.

sub_genres.name: Electroacoustic
sub_genres.description: Manipulation and processing of sound sources to create atmospheric pieces.

sub_genres.name: Electronic Dance Music
sub_genres.description: Broad category for subgenres mainly derived from Disco, featuring Electronic sounds, synthesizers, drum machines and varying BPM ranges.

sub_genres.name: Electropop
sub_genres.description: Dense, layered, and compressed production, usually coupled with a distinct fuzzy and "warm" low-frequency synthesizer style.

sub_genres.name: Epic Collage
sub_genres.description: Cinematic, dense digital collage; frequently utilizes a Deconstructed Club sonic palette and decontextualized novel samples.

sub_genres.name: Flashcore
sub_genres.description: Fast-paced short sounds, complex structures with erratic progression, and often dense and atmospheric abstract sound design, featuring recontextualized elements from IDM, Speedcore, Industrial Hardcore, and Breakcore.

sub_genres.name: Folktronica
sub_genres.description: Combines sound design techniques from IDM and Glitch with acoustic instrumentation inspired by Contemporary Folk.

sub_genres.name: Funktronica
sub_genres.description: Originated in eastern North America around the turn of the 21st century, combining trends of Synth Funk and Italo-Disco.

sub_genres.name: Glitch
sub_genres.description: Uses abstract sound design and malfunctioning electronics—CD skips, data corruption, and hardware noise—as main compositional elements.

sub_genres.name: Glitch Hop
sub_genres.description: Incorporation of IDM-derived production into drum patterns inspired by Hip Hop beats.

sub_genres.name: Graphical Sound
sub_genres.description: Compositional technique in which markings are manually applied to a medium, then processed by a machine to produce synthetic sound from the markings in real time.

sub_genres.name: HexD
sub_genres.description: Heavily bit-crushed vocals, sometimes sped-up and pitched-up, and highly compressed and distorted production, typically made from existing material of other genres.

sub_genres.name: Horror Synth
sub_genres.description: Combines eerie and haunting synth pads and sharp, abrasive sounds to create atmospheres that accentuated the dark, unnerving, violent, or ghostly themes of horror films.

sub_genres.name: Hyperpop
sub_genres.description: Developed and took inspiration from Bubblegum Bass and popular 2000s-2010s Electropop, characterized by eclectic, unconventional, mechanical-sounding and dense production; and by manipulated, usually auto-tuned vocals.

sub_genres.name: IDM
sub_genres.description: Emerged through the development of Electronic Dance Music idioms into a less club-oriented and more experimental direction, often incorporating unconventional sound design and complex rhythms.

sub_genres.name: Illbient
sub_genres.description: Combines Ambient soundscapes with Hip Hop drum patterns, breaks, and samples through the busy effect layering of Dub.

sub_genres.name: Indietronica
sub_genres.description: Leftfield or DIY approach characterised by simpler Pop-informed melodies, often incorporating vocals or live instrumentation alongside Electronic production.

sub_genres.name: Latin Electronic
sub_genres.description: Combines Electronic with Latin American influences; started at the end of the 1990s.

sub_genres.name: Livetronica
sub_genres.description: Incorporates Electronic instrumentation into live Rock jamming, drawing on a wide variety of Electronic Dance Music and Downtempo styles.

sub_genres.name: Maloya électronique
sub_genres.description: Combines the 6/8 ternary rhythm with Electronic production, using computer music, synthesizers and drum machines.

sub_genres.name: Micromontage
sub_genres.description: Arrangement of microsounds on an incredibly small time scale.

sub_genres.name: Minimal Wave
sub_genres.description: Retrospective term for more Electronic and minimal forms of New Wave, Post-Punk, Synthpop, and related styles, tending towards a more sparse and lo-fi sound.

sub_genres.name: Moogsploitation
sub_genres.description: Moog synthesizer-led music often associated with a wave of Novelty records in the 1960s and 1970s.

sub_genres.name: Nightcore
sub_genres.description: Based around the technique of speeding and pitching up pre-existing songs.

sub_genres.name: Nu Jazz
sub_genres.description: Electronic styles which feature aesthetics and occasionally instrumentation inspired by Jazz.

sub_genres.name: Power Electronics
sub_genres.description: Waves of feedback, screeching analog synthesizers, and harsh, screamed vocals.

sub_genres.name: Power Noise
sub_genres.description: Combines looped samples of Noise with Electronic rhythms.

sub_genres.name: Progressive Electronic
sub_genres.description: Synthesizer-driven genre focusing on developing, often longform compositions and drawing inspiration from various sources such as Progressive Rock, Western Classical Music, and Ambient.

sub_genres.name: Space Ambient
sub_genres.description: Flowing and relaxing synthesizer-based music derived from Progressive Electronic, often oriented around imagery of outer space.

sub_genres.name: Synth Punk
sub_genres.description: Appropriates the harsh elements of Punk Rock but replaces the predominance of guitars with synthesizers and drum machines.

sub_genres.name: Synthpop
sub_genres.description: Led by melodic synthesizer sounds, often with reverberating drum machine patterns; commonly associated with the 1980s.

sub_genres.name: Synthwave
sub_genres.description: Rooted in 1980s synth music, characterized by large, throbbing "retro" synths and visual elements, often features upbeat percussion and/or epic, cinematic atmospheres.

sub_genres.name: Tecnobrega
sub_genres.description: Fast and electronic-based style that evolved from Brega calypso, particularly associated with peripheral areas of the city of Belém.

sub_genres.name: Vapor
sub_genres.description: Meta-genre beginning with the rise of Vaporwave and the aesthetics that it spawned.

sub_genres.name: Wave
sub_genres.description: Melancholic, atmospheric, melodic beats, defined by its Trap and Cloud Rap influence, ethereal and cold production style, and abundant use of sub bass.

sub_genres.name: Witch House
sub_genres.description: Nocturnal, occult-themed/horror-inspired, and murky beats with altered, slowed down and heavily processed samples laid on top of slow Hip Hop-derived drum rhythms and droning, dense synthesizers.
